intro: Thlaspi drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's cabbageworm, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many species with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in tight, compact inflorescences. Thlaspi drummondii is also known for its ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
